snippet: Data from the Labor Department may help explain why long-term unemployment persists.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column analyzes Labor Department data showing that American workers are being fired or laid off less often than at any time in the last decade, but that companies are also less willing to hire than in the past.
lead_paragraph: Data from the Labor Department may help explain why long-term unemployment persists.

headline.print_headline: Fewer Americans Lose Jobs, but Hiring Is Also Down
headline.seo: Survey Shows Americans Are Losing Jobs at Lower Rates
headline.main: Fewer Americans Lose Jobs, but Hiring Is Also Down
